comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C0CE7DA163FE633A... "CONVICT ROAD WORK TRIED IN NEW JERSEY Commissioner Stevens Describes Successful Experiment and Tells His Plans. WOULD TRAIN THE CONVICTS Perfect Work Demanded of State Laborers for Benefit of Roads and Themselves. January 12, 1913, Sunday The experiment of convict labor on State roads, which was proved to be a success in one week, is only the beginning of good road building beyond what we already have and at a price which will spread out the money of the State beyond its present confines," said Col. Edwin A. Stevens, State Road Commissioner of New Jersey, the other day."

comment.author: 21800290@N06
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Vintage New Jersey, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
